content: I was out last night at my favorite hangout. A young man I know from poker came over and sat down. He's getting married this weekend and leaving for the Army in 2 months. He told me "I'm 23 years old. I have a son who's 16 months old and another one on the way. I've made some mistakes in my life, but it's time for me to be a man. I'm going to marry my babies' mother, and join the Army. Times are tough, and its a good job. If anything happens to me I know she and the boys will be taken care of." I almost cried. This is one of the sweetest guys I've ever met and to hear that he is stepping up and taking responsibility for his actions....well...it touched me. I hope that everything goes well and he stays safe. I also hope that someday my daughter meets someone with as much personal integrity as this young man.

title: The Kind of Man I Want My Daughter to Marry

content: The type of guy I want to marry my daughter are, the two guy that they married, now 26 years and 23 years. I really love those two guys. But, before the weddings, I officiated all for of our kids weddings, I told the guys if they ever abandoned, abused, cheated on, or made the move back home – I would hunt them down and kill them.. I’m 5’10” they are 6’2” and 6’4.” They are great guy, great husbands and great dads. BTW, I told my sons my daughters and daughter in laws the same thing. What is fair for one is fair for all. A listening ear, a caring heart, an open mind and an extend hand may be all I can offer, but they are yours without charge or judgment.

title: The Kind of Man I Want My Daughter to Marry

content: Roger that Army. I told my oldest daughter's boyfriends all the same thing. "You make her cry, and I will make you cry" ANd to be equal, I told my oldest son, to treat them all like ladies, and if they aren't ladies, don't be around them anymore. I've told both my boys, the day the ycan kick my @$$ is the day they can smack a lady.

content: I'm instilling in my kids not to get married. Do good in school, follow their dreams,see the world- get their career squared away, and THEN think about marriage if it's right for them.

content: I'm just a young traditional. I've told mine, First comes love, then comes marriage, then comes puppies. "It is the weak who are cruel. Gentleness can only be expected from the strong" -- Leo Roskin

content: I think some of the most respectful people I have ever met, both men and women, are from the military. I hope that young mans hard work pays off and he is rewarded with a loving life and wife. I sure did get sent an angel from God when he sent me my hubby. I am so thankful.

content: My son just turned 21 and is in the Marine Corps...three years almost. I'm just happy that he is content in dating and nothing more. He's been on the road a bunch with travel/training. Now he's working on E-5/Sgt. Some day, when he is more settled, then I want him to get on it with making me a grandpa. No rush.... Don
